channel.title: Deleting most of the client.java
channel.description:
Hello...again... I have been trying to delete a lot of un needed code from my client.java but i don't really know where to start... I know the publicboolean or whatever but i want to get to like the main part where i could actually deete a lot of things without screwing my server up... I've deleted like 10 things from the boolean but i know that wont bring down the size much, so if someone can like give me like keythings to delete, that'll get me started!
Thank you, -Zaron

hmm, sure, i’ll get some pointers off of it

thanks

item.title: Deleting most of the client.java
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Noo that was an example. You need go through your whole client.java 9028340928309 times

For example I’m browsing the client.java and I see this

[code] public void AddObjectFire() {
if (IsFireing == false) {
IsFireing = true;
int tmpX = 0;
int tmpY = 0;
int calcX = 0;
int calcY = 0;

  for (int i = 0; i < server.objectHandler.MaxObjects; i++) {
    if (server.itemHandler.DroppedItemsID[i] > -1) {
      tmpX = server.objectHandler.ObjectFireX[i];
      tmpY = server.objectHandler.ObjectFireY[i];
      calcX = tmpX-absX;
      calcY = tmpY-absY;
      if (calcX >= -16 && calcX <= 15 && calcY >= -16 && calcY <= 15 && FireDelete[i] == false && server.objectHandler.ObjectFireH[i] == heightLevel) {
        if (IsFireShowed[i] == false) {
          IsFireShowed[i] = true;
          ReplaceObject(server.objectHandler.ObjectFireX[i], server.objectHandler.ObjectFireY[i], server.objectHandler.ObjectFireID[i], 0, 10);
        }
      } else if (IsFireShowed[i] == true || FireDelete[i] == true) {
        ReplaceObject(server.objectHandler.ObjectFireX[i], server.objectHandler.ObjectFireY[i], -1, 0, 10);
        int LastPlayerInList = -1;
        int TotalPlayers = 0;

        for (int j = 1; j < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; j++) {
          if (PlayerHandler.players[j] != null) {
            LastPlayerInList = j;
            TotalPlayers++;
          }
        }
        if (FireDelete[i] == true) {
          FireDelete[i] = false;
          server.objectHandler.ObjectFireDeletecount[i]++;
          if ((LastPlayerInList == playerId || LastPlayerInList == -1) && server.objectHandler.ObjectFireDeletecount[i] == TotalPlayers) {
            server.objectHandler.ResetFire(i);
            for (int j = 1; j < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; j++) {
              if (PlayerHandler.players[j] != null) {
                PlayerHandler.players[j].IsFireShowed[i] = false;
              }
            }
            if (misc.random(2) == 1) {
              createItem(592);
            }
          }
        } else {
          IsFireShowed[i] = false;
        }
      }
    }
  }
  IsFireing = false;
}

}
[/code]
I search AddObjectFire(); in client.java. No results.
So I delete public void AddObjectFire

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting most of the client.java
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Deletes methods that are not used like example

public void unusedMethod() {
blah
blah
blah
blah
blah
blah
blah
}

Then search for
unusedMethod(); in client.java.
If theres no results, you can delete it
